msContents.summary: This is a multitext manuscript. There are three diffrent texts but there is a theam. All the three texts describe the auspicious place specially the holy mountain, as the titles suggests Girimahātmya. Numbering of all these three texts is separate. Numbering of every text starts with 1 except the last text Satyagirimahātmya. The first folio of the Satyagirimahātmya is not numbered. There is a blank folio after the completion of the Yādavagirimāhatmya and beginning of the Śvetagirimahātmya. All these texts are not availbel in the availabe published editions of the Nāradīyapurāṇa or Brahmāṇḍapurāṇa. On III-17v something is written in Sanskrit in Granth script. Ceṭṭalūr is a name of a village from Kerala.

support.p: Worm holes on the guard folio, 1 blank folio after front guard . Palm leaf is used as a guard folio. Guard folio are turned dark brown color.

extent.measure: 2 guard folio, 84 written folio 5 blank folio together at the beginning and at the end, plus one blank folio before beginning of the second text.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numerals are used in the left margin. Three texts has separate numeration. The first folio of the third text is not numbered. I- 1v-46v, II- 1v-20v, III-(1)-17v
supportDesc.condition: wrom holes on the folio , edges of the leaf are broken. Folio III-17r is half broken.

handNote.desc: The hand writting is clear and clean except some places it is scrawled. The 17v folio of the third text has some matter wriiten in Sanskrit and Granth script. According to the colophon all the three texts are written by onme scribe named Śrinivāsan.

additions.desc: Yādavagirimāhatmya, Śvetagirimahātmye, Satyagirimāhatmya is wriiten on the front guard folio. The first blank folio after the guard folio has again in the left side Śvetagirimahātmyam .
Title of every text is mentioned at the beginning on the first folio. I-1v 1 Yādavagirimāhatmyam . II-1v 1 Śvetagirimahātmyam . III-[1v] 1 satyagirimahātmyam .
70 is written in pink pencil on the front guard folio.
hariḥ oṃ in the left margin of the every first folio of Yādavagirimāhatmya, Śvetagirimahātmye. I-1v hariḥ oṃ II-1v hariḥ oṃ
śrīḥ śrīḥ is written in the left margin on the last folio. I-47v śrīḥ is written in the left margin. III-17r śrīḥ śrīḥ is written in the left margin.

origin.origDate:
The Yādavagirimāhatmyam is copied approximately between 1900-1901 in the Month of Magha (January) on the 11th day by Śrīnivāsan.
The Śvetagirimāhātmyam is copied approximately between 1900-1901 in the Month of Mārgaśīrṣa (January) on the 13th day by Śrīnivāsan. The Satyagirimāhātmyam is copied approximately between 1901-1902 in the Month of Mārgaśīrṣa (January) on the 2nd day by Śrīnivāsan from Ceṭṭalūr.
